titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of the President Records, Virginia B. Smith Files, 1950-2010 (bulk 1977-1986)
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2014.

did.head: Collection Summary

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Vassar College. Office of the President

did.unittitle: Office of the President Records, Virginia B. Smith Files

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Materials related to the work of the Vassar College's Office of the President during the tenure of Virginia B. Smith. The collection includes typical day-to-day administrative records, as well as documents related to noteworthy issues and events from the Smith Era (1977-1986).

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Virginia B. Smith was the eighth President of Vassar College. Before coming to the college, she had built a formidable reputation as an economist, attorney, and leader in higher education. She was born in Seattle, Washington, attended the University of Washington as well Columbia University, and worked for a variety of organizations and institutions, including the University of California, Berkeley; the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education; and the U.S. Department of Health, Education, and Welfare's Fund for the Improvement of Postsecondary Education (FIPSE).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Materials related to the work of the Vassar College's Office of the President during the tenure of Virginia B. Smith. The collection includes typical day-to-day administrative records, as well as documents related to noteworthy issues and events from the Smith Era (1977-1986). Topics include divestiture from South Africa, student protest over an invitation to William F. Buckley, Jr. to speak at Commencement, the expansion of the manuscript collections in the Library's Archives and Special Collections, and one of the largest capital campaigns in Vassar's history.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Some files in this collection are restricted and labeled as such in the container list. Other material may need to be vetted before being released. The rest is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional material may be found in the Archives and Special Collections Library in:

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Zachary Bodnar and Laura Streett, December 2014. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, March 2024.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Vassar College Office of the President, 2002. Additional materials transferred in 2004 (A2004-006), 2005 (A2005-008), 2009 (A2009-012), and 2011 (A2011-002).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Office of the President Records, Virginia B. Smith Files, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
